key_responsibilities: managing the front office, including answering, appropriately logging, and directing telephone calls
greeting visitors
monitoring office deliveries
distributing hard and electronic mail
other administrative duties
serving as the office tour coordinator
managing constituent requests for Capitol and White House tours
managing constituent requests for flags flown over the Capitol
occasional driving responsibilities
requirements: ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
strong commitment to providing outstanding constituent service
able to think on their feet

key_responsibilities: oversees all operations for district office team members and locations
develops and implements objectives and plans in support of the Member in service to the constituents
supervises the district office staff members
accountable for successful delivery of all district office operations, outreach, constituent services, and other activities
compliant with relevant laws, rules of ethics, and policies of the House of Representatives
sets an example for respect, collaboration, and transparency in all matters
supervises as many as 7 employees in all aspects of their roles, including planning, assigning, directing, and assessing their work
accountable for the work product of staff members in the district offices
oversees constituent casework activities
represents the Member with constituents, at events, and with stakeholder organizations and individuals
develops and implements and operating plan for the Member in the district that is aligned with the Member’s strategic vision and goals and helps the Member serve the constituents
facilitates communication and collaboration between the district office and Washington, DC office
builds and nurtures relationships on behalf of the Member with constituents, community leaders, and organizations in the district
requirements: experience in community relations, outreach, and effectively managing relationships with government and community stakeholders
experience with leading and managing a team
ability to navigate and resolve complex situations involving multiple perspectives, differing expectations, and complicated issues
strong written and verbal communications skills

office: House Committee on Education and the Workforce (Democratic staff)
key_responsibilities: drafting press releases, statements, and other press materials
maintaining press lists
compiling and distributing daily press clips
media monitoring
other tasks as assigned
requirements: degree in journalism, communications, political science or a related area
experience with creating and executing press events

key_responsibilities: drafting press releases
writing statements
talking points
maintaining relationships and booking interviews with national and local press outlets
pitching stories
responding to reporter inquiries
creating and posting social media posts
compiling news clips
managing the Member’s website
assisting with the constituent outreach program
other duties as assigned
advancing press events and staff the Member as needed
working in close collaboration with the Chief of Staff, District Director, Legislative Director, and other staff as appropriate
requirements: proficiency in photo and video editing and graphic design tools
highly motivated to serve on an active team
experience working in a fast-paced environment
prepared to implement a communications plan
